intro: Ceropegia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tubular flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appeal contribute to its popularity among plant enthusiasts.
